en.MainMenuC: I'm here, I'm a matter particle. Let's start our trip!
en.MainMenuD: Look around you, all you can see, all things in the world are made up of matter.
en.MainMenuE: A car, a banana, an elephant, even you!
en.WeightA: All you can see is composed of matter, matter has a weight and volume.
en.WeightB: The mass of a substance is the amount of matter that it has. That’s just how heavy something is.
en.WeightC: Tap on the object and drag it to the scale to know its weight.
en.VolumA: The volume is the amount of space that matter occupies.
en.VolumB: When you pour water into a glass, the water’s volume is the amount of space that it takes up in the glass.
en.VolumC: Tap on the object and drag it to the glass with water to know its volume.
en.CharSelA: The matter can be divided into tiny particles that are too small to be seen, like me!
en.CharSelB: All things in the world come in three forms states, these are: solid, liquid and gas.
en.CharSelC: Depending on the separation of the particles, is the state that the matter will take.
en.CharSelD: Let's discover the three forms states!
en.TutoIce: Click on the screen to Jump.
en.TutoLiquid: Tap and move the liquid horizontally on the screen to avoid the dangers.
en.TutoGas: Click on a row to move the character.
en.InfoSolid: Particles in solids are very close to each other, so they have less space to move. Has a definite shape.
en.InfoLiquid: Particles in solids are very close to each other, so they have less space to move. Has a definite shape.
en.InfoGas: Particles in solids are very close to each other, so they have less space to move. Has a definite shape.
en.TutoPuzzle: Select the correct state of matter to solve the puzzle.
en.EndText: Congratulations! On this trip we discovered the matter and its states!
